de.dfki.omm.tools

Class OMMXMLConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.omm.tools.OMMXMLConverter

  • public class OMMXMLConverter
extends java.lang.Object
    Conversion tool to parse OMM elements from XML documents and create XML documents from OMM objects.

      • parseHeader

        public static OMMHeader parseHeader(org.w3c.dom.Element root)
        Parses an OMMHeader from an XML Element.
        Parameters:
        root - The Element containing the header.
        Returns:
        The parsed header as OMMHeaderImpl or, if possible, OMMSecurityHeaderImpl.

      • parseBlock

        public static OMMBlock parseBlock(org.w3c.dom.Element e)
        Parses an OMMBlock from an XML Element.
        Parameters:
        e - The Element containing the block.
        Returns:
        The parsed block as OMMBlockImpl or, if possible, one of its more specified subtypes.

      • parseBlock

        public static OMMBlock parseBlock(org.w3c.dom.Element e,
                                  java.lang.String blockID)
        Parses an OMMBlock from an XML Element.
        Parameters:
        e - The Element containing the block.
        blockID - ID of the block to be parsed.
        Returns:
        The parsed block as OMMBlockImpl or, if possible, one of its more specified subtypes.

      • getTypedValue

        public static TypedValue getTypedValue(java.lang.String type,
                                       java.lang.String value)
        Converts an explicitly given type and value pair to a TypedValue object.
        Parameters:
        type - The type.
        value - The value.
        Returns:
        A TypedValue object incorporating the given type and value, usually a GenericTypedValue, unless the type is "base64" or "uuencode", in which case the method returns a BinaryValue.

      • generateHeaderDocument

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document generateHeaderDocument(OMMHeader header)
        Creates an XML Document representing a given OMMHeader.
        Parameters:
        header - The header to convert to XML.
        Returns:
        A Document containing an XML representation of the header.

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element generateToCElement(java.util.Collection<OMMToCEntry> toc)
        Creates an XML Element representing a given Collection of OMMToCEntrys.
        Parameters:
        toc - The ToC to convert to XML.
        Returns:
        An Element containing an XML representation of the Table of Contents.

      • generateToCEntry

        public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> generateToCEntry(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                                   OMMToCEntry toc)
        Creates a List of XML Elements out of an empty XML Document and a ToC entry.
        Parameters:
        doc - A new empty XML Document (can be obtained by calling createNewXmlDocument()).
        toc - An OMMToCEntry to convert to XML.
        Returns:
        List of the created Elements.

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document createNewXmlDocument()
        Creates a new empty Document to use as a template to fill with contents.
        Returns:
        The bare XMl Document.

      • createXmlElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createXmlElement(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                   java.lang.String name,
                                                   java.lang.String prefix,
                                                   java.lang.String namespaceURI)
        Creates an XML Element using an XML Document and the element's attributes.
        Parameters:
        doc - An XML Document which may be empty (can be obtained by calling createNewXmlDocument()).
        name - The element's name.
        prefix - The element's name prefix (such as "omm").
        namespaceURI - The namespace URI to use for this element.
        Returns:
        The created Element.

      • createXmlElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createXmlElement(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                   java.lang.String name)
        Creates an XML Element using an XML Document and the element's name.
        Parameters:
        doc - An XML Document which may be empty (can be obtained by calling createNewXmlDocument()).
        name - The element's name.
        Returns:
        The created Element.

      • createXmlElementAndAppend

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element createXmlElementAndAppend(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                            java.lang.String name,
                                                            java.lang.String prefix,
                                                            java.lang.String namespaceURI)
        Creates an XML Element using an XML Document and the element's attributes, and adds the element to the document.
        Parameters:
        doc - An XML Document which may be empty (can be obtained by calling createNewXmlDocument()).
        name - The element's name.
        prefix - The element's name prefix (such as "omm").
        namespaceURI - The namespace URI to use for this element.
        Returns:
        The created Element (The element is added to the document as a side effect).

      • getXmlDocumentFromString

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document getXmlDocumentFromString(java.io.InputStream is)
        Converts a String from an InputStream to an XML Document.
        Parameters:
        is - Input stream delivering the String.
        Returns:
        XML Document built from the input (null if no document could be created).

      • generateCompleteBlock

        public static org.w3c.dom.Document generateCompleteBlock(OMMBlock block,
                                                         boolean withPayload)
        Creates an XML Document containing a complete representation of an OMMBlock.
        Parameters:
        block - The OMMBlock to represent in XMl.
        withPayload - True, if the payload is to be included in the representation.
        Returns:
        The block as an XMl Document.

      • generateBlock

        public static java.util.List<org.w3c.dom.Element> generateBlock(org.w3c.dom.Document doc,
                                                                OMMBlock block,
                                                                boolean withPayload)
        Creates a List of XML Elements that describe a given block.
        Parameters:
        doc - An XML Document which may be empty (can be obtained by calling createNewXmlDocument()).
        block - The block to represent in XML.
        withPayload - True, if the payload is to be included in the representation.
        Returns:
        A List of XML Elements that represent the block.

        Parameters:
        doc - An XML Document which may be empty (can be obtained by calling createNewXmlDocument()).
        block - A OMMBlock.
        Returns:

        tag - The OMMSubjectTag to be represented in XML.
        Returns:

      • toXMLFileString

        public static java.lang.String toXMLFileString(java.util.Collection<OMMToCEntry> toc)
        Converts a block's Table of Contents to a String representation to use as out- or input.
        Parameters:
        toc - The Table of Contents as a Collection of OMMToCEntrys.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the Table of Contents.

      • loadFromXmlFile

        public static OMM loadFromXmlFile(java.io.File xmlfile)
        Creates an OMM from an XML representation stored in a local file.
        Parameters:
        xmlfile - The file containing the XML text.
        Returns:
        The created OMM (or null if none could be parsed).

      • loadFromXmlString

        public static OMM loadFromXmlString(java.lang.String xmlText,
                                    java.net.URL urlSource,
                                    java.io.File fileSource,
                                    OMMSourceType sourceType)

        Creates an OMM from an XML representation given as String with its respective source where the OMM will be stored and loaded at restart of the server. The source can be either a URL or a File and has to be described by a OMMSourceType.

        With one source given the other can be null, but not both.

        Parameters:
        xmlText - An XML representation of an object memory.
        urlSource - Source of the OMM as URL.
        Source - of the OMM as a File.
        sourceType - The OMMSourceType of the source.
        Returns:
        The loaded memory as a OMM.

      • loadFromXmlStringReader

        public static OMM loadFromXmlStringReader(java.io.InputStream xml,
                                          java.net.URL urlSource,
                                          java.io.File fileSource,
                                          OMMSourceType sourceType)

        Creates an OMM from an XML representation given through an input stream with its respective source where the OMM will be stored and loaded at restart of the server. The source can be either a URL or a File and has to be described by a OMMSourceType.

        With one source given the other can be null, but not both.

        Parameters:
        xml - An XML representation wrapped in an InputStream.
        urlSource - Source of the OMM as URL.
        Source - of the OMM as a File.
        sourceType - The OMMSourceType of the source.
        Returns:
        The loaded memory as a OMM.

      • toXMLFileString

        public static java.lang.String toXMLFileString(OMM omm,
                                               boolean withToC)
        Converts an object memory to a representative String.
        Parameters:
        omm - The OMM to represent as String.
        withToC - True, if the Table of Contents is to be included.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the OMM.

      • downloadURL

        public static java.lang.String downloadURL(java.lang.String urlString,
                                           OMSCredentials credentials)
        Retrieves the GET output of a REST node as String.
        Parameters:
        urlString - URL to the REST node.
        credentials - OMSCredentials to use when accessing the node.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the node's output (null, if none could be retrieved).

      • isOMMIDsBlock

        public static boolean isOMMIDsBlock(OMMBlock block)
        Checks whether a block is an Identifier Block.
        Parameters:
        block - The OMMBlock to check.
        Returns:
        True, if the block is an OMMIdentifierBlock.

      • isOMMIDsBlock

        public static boolean isOMMIDsBlock(java.net.URI namespace)
        Checks whether a namespace URI is identical to the Identifier Block URI.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to check as a URI.
        Returns:
        True, if the given URI equals "urn:omm:block:indentifications".

      • isOMMStructureBlock

        public static boolean isOMMStructureBlock(OMMBlock block)
        Checks whether a block is a Structure Block.
        Parameters:
        block - The OMMBlock to check.
        Returns:
        True, if the block is an OMMStructureBlock.

      • isOMMStructureBlock

        public static boolean isOMMStructureBlock(java.net.URI namespace)
        Checks whether a namespace URI is identical to the Structure Block URI.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to check as a URI.
        Returns:
        True, if the given URI equals "urn:omm:block:structure".

      • isOMMSemanticsBlock

        public static boolean isOMMSemanticsBlock(OMMBlock block)
        Checks whether a block is a Semantics Block.
        Parameters:
        block - The OMMBlock to check.
        Returns:
        True, if the block is an OMMSemanticsBlock.

      • isOMMSemanticsBlock

        public static boolean isOMMSemanticsBlock(java.net.URI namespace)
        Checks whether a namespace URI is identical to the Semantics Block URI.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace to check as a URI.
        Returns:
        True, if the given URI equals "urn:omm:block:semantic".

        Checks whether a block is a Attribute List Block.
        Parameters:
        block - The OMMBlock to check.
        Returns:

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element findChild(org.w3c.dom.Element root,
                                            java.lang.String childName)
        Finds and returns a specific child in an XML element.
        Parameters:
        root - The XML element to inspect.
        childName - The element name to search for.
        Returns:
        The searched child Element (or null, if no match was found).

      • firstElement

        public static org.w3c.dom.Element firstElement(org.w3c.dom.Element root)
        Retrieves the first child of an XML Element.
        Parameters:
        root - The element of which to get the first child Element.
        Returns:
        First child Element of the given root (or null, if there isn't one).

      • removeXMLHeader

        public static java.lang.String removeXMLHeader(java.lang.String text)
        Removes the XML header from a given String.
        Parameters:
        text - String from which to remove the header.
        Returns:
        The cleansed String (or the unaltered String, if it does not include a header).

      • getISO8601String

        public static java.lang.String getISO8601String(java.lang.String type,
                                                java.lang.String value)
        Returns an ISO8601 date from a given type/value-pair if the pair describes one.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the given value.
        value - The value to parse as an ISO8601 date, if possible.
        Returns:
        The value, if the pair describes an ISO8601 date, otherwise null.

      • getMemoryName

        public static java.lang.String getMemoryName(java.lang.String omsURL)
        Retrieves an OMM's name from its URL.
        Parameters:
        omsURL - The address of the object memory.
        Returns:
        The name of the object memory (as the last node in the given URL).

      • getInputStreamFromText

        public static java.io.InputStream getInputStreamFromText(java.lang.String text)
        Wraps a String in an input stream.
        Parameters:
        text - The String to wrap.
        Returns:
        An InputStream wrapping the input String (or null, if it causes an error).

      • getSubjectTag

        public static OMMSubjectTag getSubjectTag(org.w3c.dom.Element node)
        Retrieves a subject tag from an XML node.
        Parameters:
        node - The XML Element to parse.
        Returns:
        A OMMSubjectTag derived from the node.
